<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_pha"><span class="unitcode">PAC4482</span> - Preparation for practice<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">6 points, SCA Band 2, 0.125 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-PAC4482">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_pha">Undergraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-pha.html">Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Chief examiner(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Suzanne Caliph">Dr Suzanne Caliph</a>
<br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Coordinator(s)</p>
<p>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Suzanne Caliph">Dr Suzanne Caliph</a>
        
        (Parkville)
      
    <br/>
<a href="http://staffsearch.monash.edu/?name=Juman Dujaili">Juman Dujaili</a>
        
        (Malaysia)
      
    <br/>
</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Unit guides</p>
<ul>
<li>
<a href="http://unitguidemanager.monash.edu/view?unitCode=PAC4482&amp;tpCode=S2-01&amp;tpYear=2019">Second semester</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble " id="preamble-PAC4482">
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<div class="hbk-preamble-icon hbk-preamble-icon_mode"></div>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Offered</p>
<p><a href="index-bylocation-malaysia.html">Malaysia</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>Second semester 2019 (On-campus)</li></ul><p><a href="index-bylocation-parkville.html">Parkville</a></p><ul class="hbk-preamble-list__offerings"><li>Second semester 2019 (On-campus)</li></ul>
</div>
<div class="hbk-preamble-entry">
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prerequisites</p>
<p>PAC3421</p>
<p>PAC3432</p>
<p><span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/PAC4441.html">PAC4441</a></span></p>
<p><span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/PAC4451.html">PAC4451</a></span></p>
<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Co-requisites</p>
<p><span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/PAC4472.html">PAC4472</a></span></p>
<p><span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/PAC4462.html">PAC4462</a></span></p>
</div>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>This unit builds on the knowledge and skills developed in the BPharm course. This unit is predominantly conducted through group project work to provide the necessary skills for Continued Profession Development, improve oral and written communication and literature search and evaluation skills. It includes an online moderated discussion group to manage complex patient issues and to familiarise students with the teaching and learning approaches utilised in the Monash Intern Training Program. Students will perform a number of tasks which will help with the development and assessment of communication and clinical problem solving skills, critical thinking skills and develop their skills in decision-making and case-presentation.</p>
<p>The unit comprises three activities:</p>
<ul>
<li>Activity 1: Literature review assignment. This will include a literature review and presentation of assigned pharmacy research related topics completed in small groups.</li>
<li>Activity 2: Complex patient care. This will consist of 3 blocks ofone week moderated discussion groups</li>
<li>Activity 3: Integrated Objective Structured Clinical Examination (OSCE)</li>
</ul>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>At the end of this unit students will be able to:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>Retrieve and evaluate information on a range of pharmacy research related topics and present information in a coherent manner in both written and oral forms;</li>
<li>Communicate effectively to peers and work in a team to achieve a common goal;</li>
<li>Identify and analyse therapeutic management problems in complex patients with multiple disease states and determine appropriate monitoring regimens and management options that demonstrate the principles of evidence-based practice and quality use of medicines;</li>
<li>Formulate an appropriate management plan for a patient based on the use of drug and non-drug therapies;</li>
<li>Recognise when referral for medical assessment is required with a particular emphasis on cardinal symptoms;</li>
<li>Communicate effectively with patients, carers and health professionals to identify drug therapy or illnesses or disease state management problems and recommend appropriate management options and resolutions of those problems</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<p>Activity 1: Literature Review Assignment 20%</p>
<p>Activity 2: Complex patient discussion group 10%</p>
<p>Activity 3: Integrated Objective Structured Clinical Examination (OSCE - Oral examination) 40% (Hurdle - minimum 75% is required to pass this assessment)</p>
<p>Final Written Examination 30%</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>Contact hours for on-campus students:</p>
<ul>
<li>Four 1-hour workshops</li>
<li>One 2-hour workshop</li>
</ul>
<p>Additional requirements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Three weeks of moderated online discussion groups (approximately 3-4hours/week)</li>
<li>Forty hours group project work including a written report and an oral presentation</li>
<li>Six hours group presentations</li>
</ul><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Additional information on this unit is available from the faculty at:</h2>
<div>
<p><a href="http://www.monash.edu/pharm/current/">http://www.monash.edu/pharm/current/</a> </p>
</div>
<!-- /.content_container--> </div>
<!-- /.content-inner__main --></div>

<div class="hbk-banner-box">
<h1 class="banner_med"><span class="unitcode">NUR3009</span> - Transition to professional practice<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">12 points, SCA Band 1, 0.250 EFTSL</h2>
<div class="hbk-unit-info-box" id="box-NUR3009">
<h2 class="hbk-unit-info-box__heading heading_med">Undergraduate - Unit</h2>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value">Refer to the specific
         <a href="http://monash.edu/enrolments/dates/census.html">census and withdrawal dates</a>
         for the semester(s) in which this unit is offered.</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Faculty</p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-value"><a href="index-byfaculty-med.html">Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences</a></p>
<p class="hbk-highlight-heading">Organisational Unit</p>

<p class="hbk-preamble-heading">Prerequisites</p>
<p><span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/NUR3002.html">NUR3002</a></span> or <span class="unitlink"><a href="/pubs/2019handbooks/units/NUR3106.html">NUR3106</a><span class="unitoffered">Not offered in 2019</span></span>.</p>
</div>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>This unit addresses issues associated with transition to rural nursing practice and prepares students for the expanded generalist role that characterises rural nursing practice. Concerned with preparing students for a satisfying and sustainable rural nursing career, the unit requires students to explore opportunities for continuing education, professional affiliation and engagement and career advancement.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>Upon successful completion of this unit, students should be able to:</p>
<p>Educational Objectives:</p>
<ol princestart="0" start="1" type="1">
<li>develop a career path plan;</li>
<li>evaluate the contribution of leadership, management, teamwork and interdisciplinary collaboration in facilitating case management and optimal health outcomes;</li>
<li>evaluate a range of strategies to effectively manage challenging and critical incidents commonly associated with the Division 1RN role;</li>
<li>critically analyse the importance of professional affiliation and life-long learning in advancing health outcomes;</li>
<li>apply the principles of adult learning to identify your specific learning needs;</li>
<li>reflect critically on your own actions, professional role development and on the nature of nursing practice;

<p>Clinical Objectives:</p></li>
<li>apply problem solving and time management strategies to effectively organize clinical workloads;</li>
<li>manage clinical problems appropriately;</li>
<li>practise with increasing independence demonstrating AN&amp;MC competencies;</li>
<li>demonstrate safe evidence-based practice in the clinical setting.</li>
</ol>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<ul>
<li>Assignment (3,000 words) (50%)</li>
<li>Clinical learning contract (20%)</li>
<li>Clinical report (reflective) (30%)</li>
</ul>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>3 hour lecture per week, 2 hour tutorial per week, 2 hours on-line activities per week for 4 weeks. A total of 124 hours of Student directed learning.</p><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">This unit applies to the following area(s) of study</h2>
<div>
<p><a href="../aos/nursing">Nursing</a></p>
<p><a href="../aos/nursing-and-midwifery">Nursing and midwifery</a></p>
</div>

<h1 class="banner_eng"><span class="unitcode">MAE5405</span> - Avionics<span class="hbk-archive-only"> - 2019</span></h1>
</div>
<div id="content_container_">
<h2 class="hbk-eftsl">6 points, SCA Band 2, 0.125 EFTSL</h2>

<p>Not offered in 2019</p>

<h2 class="hbk-heading">Synopsis</h2>
<div>
<p>Avionics is the title given to the electronic systems that are necessary for the effective control, operation and mission applications of modern aircraft. This unit introduces students to the fundamental principles, technologies and systems that define avionics technology. It provides a coherent and unified framework to model and analyse the elements of avionics systems. The focus is on the physical phenomena and analytical procedures required to understand avionics sub-systems and their integration. The unit will guide students towards an application of how fundamental techniques of electronics, communications, information and control theory are applied to modern avionics systems.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Outcomes</h2>
<div>
<p>The development and integration of previous knowledge in mechanics, electronics and control theory based on previous study leading towards an understanding of current avionics technology within a guided and self-learning environment.</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Assessment</h2>
<div>
<p>Projects: 20% + Assignments: 30% + Examination: 50%</p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">Workload requirements</h2>
<div>
<p>3 hours lectures, 2 hours practical classes and 7 hours of private study per week</p><p>See also <a href="http://www.monash.edu.au/timetables/">Unit timetable information</a></p>
</div>
<h2 class="hbk-heading">This unit applies to the following area(s) of study</h2>
<div>
<p>Aerospace Engineering</p>
</div>
